instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2494: What is 820-2494? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

This board don't turn on, only green light on the LED 1. I try to turn on by a short pad and no lucky .. Any some tips for this cancer issue ? 

thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message:
Check Power Sequencing Block Diagram and post some voltage values there.
Don't forget to check L7920 voltage...

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_S5_REG</SIGNAL> - 1.113V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL> - 3.373V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> - 4.985V

<SIGNAL>PP12V_S5</SIGNAL> - 12.05V 

ALL S5 voltages ok! This is no first time i have this issue in imacs. usually this machines leave without a solution!! because i say this issue is a cancer! ty for reply!

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message: Check all rails for shorts. Any history on this machine? It is pretty antique....

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message: No shorts in rails.. And i call to costumer and he say the machine turn off and never turn on... You have any more idea ?? thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>? 
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> toggling when power on pads shorted?

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> - 3.35V

<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> - 3.35 and when i toggling goes to 0.18V and don't turn on.. I think it must be a little problem..

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message:
How are your S4 voltages doing? <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> High?

<SIGNAL>PGOOD_1V1_S5</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message: Hi, please share how you fixed the problem, I have two board with exactly same issue, only first led is on, there isn't any visible damage under microscope

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message: There are no "please bro" solutions for this stuff. Check for shorts on all rails first.

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message:
+1 
Same model, same symptoms.
Checked all the rails and got the same values as OP.
Did you manage to fix it or threw it away?

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message: Common issue on these is <CHIP>U7300</CHIP>, check if enable is present.

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message: Yes <SIGNAL>5VREG_EN</SIGNAL> on pin 1 of <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> is present and showing 3.35V is that normal?

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message: Yes, but I bet the 5V is not being made cause <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> is dead.

threads.title: [SOLVED]IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , This board don't turn ON!
threads.message: And you are absolutely right! After <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> replacement everything is working again! Another star to Duke! Thanks.
